III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health Services; Policies and Procedures
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 07/25/23, youth presented with bruises on her arm and a
handprint bruise on her leg. It is unknown who and how these
bruises were caused. Youth believes bad spirits come into her
room at night, causing the bruises on her body. There are
concerns for youth's mental health and physical safety.
Investigation This complaint was received on 07/28/2023 and investigated
jointly with the MDHHS Specialist.
I interviewed Youth A’s Foster Care Worker on 07/28/2023. Foster
Care Worker reported Youth A is doing well and she has no
concerns regarding Youth A’s physical and mental health. Youth A
is receiving therapy and has been examined by her doctor and
Hematologist regarding the bruising.
I interviewed Consumer Rights Officer at the facility on
07/28/2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. He reported
Youth A does have a history of having unexplained bruising, she
has been examined by the nurse, doctor, and was referred to a
specialist at Children’s Hospital in June 2023. Youth A has a
follow up appointment with the Hematologist on 08/03/2023. Youth
A meets weekly with her therapist and has been taking her
medication.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 07/28/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A initially did not want to be
interviewed, but after a few minutes of talking to her she agreed to
be interviewed. Youth A reported she has two bruises on her the
interior of her lower arms and a couple bruise on her upper legs.
She does not know what causes the bruises. Youth A said she
has been examined by the doctor and nurse. Youth A said she
sees her therapist weekly and takes her prescribed medication
daily. She expressed no concerns regarding staff or the facility.
I interviewed Youth B on 07/28/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS
Specialist. Youth B is on the same wing with Youth A. Youth B
2

reported she has been at the facility for 2 years. Youth B is
participating in therapy and takes her medication daily. Youth B
witnessed Youth A poking her arms with something, a sharp
object, so she reported it to staff. Youth B reported she feels safe
at the facility and expressed no concerns regarding staff.
I interviewed Therapist on 07/28/2023 in collaboration with
MDHHS Specialist. Therapist reported Youth A has been seen
with random bruising on the arms and legs. It started in April of
2023, and Youth A has been examined by the nurse, doctor, and
Hematologist. Therapist said Youth A does have a history of self-
harming and that is being addressed in therapy. On 07/26/2023
during therapy Youth A said she was joking when she told her
physical therapist that ghosts/bad spirits were causing the
bruising. She completed a room search on Youth A’s room and
found a piece of glass, a straightened staple, and a can of air
freshener. Youth A is currently on a plan to have her room
searched twice every shift, her toiletries were removed and are
being administered by staff when she needs them, and she is
being monitored closely by staff. Therapist does daily check-in
with Youth A.
I interviewed Consumer Rights Officer on 08/11/2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Consumer Rights Officer
reported Youth A had a follow up appointment on 08/03/2023 at
Children’s Hospital, but she refused to go. Youth A’s appointment
was rescheduled for 08/18/2023. He reported security checks are
done at the start and end of each shift. He further reported that all
cleaning products and air fresheners are now being stored in the
closet outside of the wings.
I interviewed Staff 1 on 08/11/2023 at the facility, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 reported she and Staff 2
transported Youth A to her physical therapy appointment on
07/25/2023, and this was when Youth A reported that spirits are
causing the bruises on her arms and legs. Staff 1 said room
checks are done daily and there has been no issues or concerns
for Youth A. Staff 1 said all cleaning products and air fresheners
are locked in the closet outside of the wing.
On 08/11/2023, a walk through the facility was completed. The
closet with cleaning products and air fresheners was observed to
be located outside of the wing.
A predisposition conference held with MDHHS Specialist on
08/22/2023. There is no finding by MDHHS Specialist.
3

Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A medical reports.
➢ On 4/20/23 Youth A examined by doctor on campus
for unexplained bruising, youth deny any trauma,
and reported she would wake up with bruises.
Referred to hematology.
➢ On 06/16/23 Youth A had medical appointment with
hematology at Children’s Hospital for bruising with
no known cause. Thyroid testing normal, iron sat low
ferritin in low-normal range, and HGB 13.6. Has a
follow up appointment 08/03/2023.
➢ On 07/25/23 Youth A examined by doctor on
campus for unexplained bruising and petechiae.
Youth A had bruising on both upper arms and one
bruise on upper left thigh. Youth denies trauma or
injury. Youth has a follow up with hematology.
➢ On 08/03/2023 Youth A refused to go to Children’s
Hospital for follow up appointment with Hematology.
➢ On 08/18/2023 Youth A was seen by Doctor 2 at
Children’s Hospital. Youth reports a history of easy
bruising. Thyroid test normal, fibrinogen normal,
collagen binding and GP1bm both normal. A follow
appointment scheduled for 10/25/2023.
• Youth A’s safety plan dated 07/26/2023-purpose of the plan
is to assist Youth A with eliminating unsafe/self-harming
behavior through use of intervention, coping skills, and
effective communication techniques. Youth A’s room will be
searched at the beginning and end of each shift, Youth A’s
clothing will be stored in the linen closet, Staff will stand in
the doorway of the bathroom while Youth A uses the
shower or restroom, and Youth A's room will be free of all
items.
• Psychological evaluation dated 07/28/2023 per request of
her therapist. Youth A has spontaneous bruising for which
she was evaluated by Hematology. Youth A explained the
bruising is from her picking at whiteheads on her skin.
Mood: depressed but denies self-harming or having suicidal
thoughts. Youth A has been taking her medication.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as there is insufficient
evidence that youth is not receiving treatment for mental and
medical health based on interviews with staff, youth, and
documentation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
